description_txt: stated on May 11, 2015 in news reports:
quote_txt: Georgia is on track for 1,200 traffic fatalities this year, a reversal of nine years of declines.

description_txt: stated on May 14, 2015 in a tweet:
quote_txt: Says Thomas Jefferson said "that government is best which governs least."

description_txt: stated on March 16, 2015 in an interview:
quote_txt: The average age of planes in the Qatar Airways fleet is about four years while Delta Air Lines flies planes that are 35 years old.

description_txt: stated on May 13, 2015 in a broadcast of "The Kelly File":
quote_txt: The lack of an automatic braking system that could have prevented the Philadelphia Amtrak crash "wasn't driven by a lack of funding. It just takes a while. They (Congress) just passed it in the recent past."

description_txt: stated on May 13, 2015 in remarks to reporters:
quote_txt: "It is simply a fact that insufficient funding for Amtrak has delayed the installation" of a positive train control safety system. "To deny a connection between the (derailment in Philadelphia) and underfunding Amtrak is to deny reality."

description_txt: stated on May 17, 2015 in an interview on Fox News:
quote_txt: On whether the Iraq War was a mistake.

description_txt: stated on February 9, 2015 in an Austin City Council workshop:
quote_txt: "Austin is the only city in an arid landscape in the western United States dependent on a single source of water."

description_txt: stated on May 13, 2015 in a tweet:
quote_txt: "You can be an NFL player with murder charges and not be suspended."

description_txt: stated on May 13, 2015 in a response to a question after a town hall meeting:
quote_txt: "We had an agreement that the president could have signed that would have kept 10,000 troops" in Iraq.

description_txt: stated on April 27, 2015 in his debut Senate floor speech:
quote_txt: The Fair Tax proposal encourages innovation and investment "level the playing field" for American companies to compete globally.

description_txt: stated on May 7, 2015 in a campaign flyer.:
quote_txt: State legislators "quietly shifted $2 billion from education to road building" in 2013.

description_txt: stated on May 17, 2015 in an interview on CNN's "Fareed Zakaria GPS":
quote_txt: The "highest economic growth decade was the 1960s. Income tax rates were 90 percent."

description_txt: stated on May 17, 2015 in on CNN's "State of the Union":
quote_txt: "Every president since Franklin Delano Roosevelt has had" fast-track trade authority.

description_txt: stated on April 29, 2015 in testimony before the House Judiciary Committee:
quote_txt: "The proportion of Rhode Islanders entering substance abuse treatment primarily due to marijuana use has reached its highest point in 20 years."

description_txt: stated on April 28, 2015 in a press release:
quote_txt: "In the last 24 months, 10 rural Texas hospitals have been forced to shut their doors because state leaders" chose not to expand Medicaid.

description_txt: stated on May 7, 2015 in an interview on MSNBC's "Morning Joe":
quote_txt: Due to "over-incarceration … in 1950, two out of three young black men were in the workforce. Today, it's one out of three black men are in the workforce."

description_txt: stated on April 30, 2015 in a news release.:
quote_txt: The 2005 round of military base closings "has not yet resulted in savings."

description_txt: stated on May 4, 2015 in a tweet:
quote_txt: "Florida sends $135 billion and D.C. returns $150 billion."

description_txt: stated on May 5, 2015 in remarks at the Institute for New Economic Thinking:
quote_txt: Proposed fast-track legislation allows presidents to "easily use a future trade deal to override our domestic financial rules."

description_txt: stated on May 10, 2015 in comments on "Fox News Sunday":
quote_txt: More money is dedicated within the Department of Homeland Security to climate change than what's spent combating "Islamist terrorists radicalizing over the Internet in the United States of America."

description_txt: stated on May 1, 2015 in a commentary in The Providence Journal:
quote_txt: Annual precipitation "has increased in Rhode Island by over 12 inches in the last century."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • May 14, 2015

description_txt: stated on May 10, 2015 in a pundit panel on "Face the Nation":
quote_txt: Says Mike Huckabee appeared in diabetes infomercials to endorse "cures and treatments that no health agency supports."

description_txt: stated on May 1, 2015 in the National Review Forum:
quote_txt: "We have a legal immigration system in America that accepts 1 million people a year, legally. No other country in the world even comes close to that."

description_txt: stated on May 6, 2015 in a committee hearing:
quote_txt: "Transgender individuals in the U.S. have a 1-in-12 chance of being murdered."

description_txt: stated on April 25, 2015 in an interview:
quote_txt: Says that as president, Barack Obama has not gone to the Texas-Mexico border

description_txt: stated on March 31, 2015 in interviews:
quote_txt: The state budget will include scholarship money for minority students as a concession to Senate Democrats for supporting the GOP-initiated transportation bill.

description_txt: stated on May 10, 2015 in comments on ABC's "This Week":
quote_txt: "During the Bush administration, you actually had a prominent liberal write a book about how Bush was preparing for a fascist takeover of this country."

description_txt: stated on May 6, 2015 in a press release:
quote_txt: "Once again, a police officer has been killed with an illegal gun from Georgia – a state that last year did the NRA’s bidding and weakened its already lax gun laws."

description_txt: stated on May 4, 2015 in a Facebook meme:
quote_txt: "Ben Carson is running for president to ‘eliminate dependency on government.’ But he doesn’t mention that he grew up in public schools, got public housing and food stamps, got free glasses from a government program, was helped by Affirmative Action, and got Pell Grants for college."

description_txt: stated on May 6, 2015 in an interview in Washington, D.C.:
quote_txt: "The families that are covered through the Low Income Pool is a different group of individuals than are covered by Obamacare."
